qas.question: In which century were vocalization marking added to the Quran?
Where were Quran copies kept for those who could not afford their own?
What are the parts of the Quran called that are 30 in total?
Which group of Quran copyists produced the most in-demand manuscripts?
In which century were vocalization marking taken from the Quran?
Where were Quran copies kept for those who could afford their own?
Where weren't Quran copies kept for those who could not afford their own?
What are the parts of the Quran called that are 33 in total?
Which group of Quran copyists produced the least in-demand manuscripts?

context: In the beginning, the Quran did not have vocalization markings. The system of vocalization, as we know it today, seems to have been introduced towards the end of the <a0_0><b4_0>ninth century<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Since it would have been too costly for most Muslims to purchase a manuscript, copies of the Quran were held in <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>mosques<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> in order to make them accessible to people. These copies frequently took the form of a series of 30 parts or <a2_0><b7_0>juzʼ<b7_0/><a2_0/>. In terms of productivity, the <a3_0><b8_0>Ottoman<b8_0/><a3_0/> copyists provide the best example. This was in response to widespread demand, unpopularity of printing methods and for aesthetic reasons.
